org.timepedia.chronoscope.client.gss
Interface GssElement

All Known Implementing Classes:
AxisPanel, BarChartXYRenderer, CompositeAxisPanel, DatasetLegendPanel, DatasetRenderer, DateRangePanel, DomainAxisPanel, DomainBarMarker, GssBackground, GssElementImpl, LegendAxisPanel, LineXYRenderer, Marker, OverviewAxisPanel, RangeAxisPanel, RangeBarMarker, ZoomPanel
public interface GssElement

A GssElement represents a phantom element to which Graph Style Sheets are applied. In the browser, these are realized as real DOM elements with the getType() as the element name, and getTypeClass() as the class attribute. The CSS engine of the browser is leveraged to target the (hidden) GSS DOM elements.

For a server side implementation, GssElement may be implemented as specialized classes used by the Apache Batik CSS Engine.

For some applications, textual GSS can be avoided, and a hard coded implementation of GssContext can be used to return fixed answers for a given GssElement. This is most useful when deploying specialized J2ME phone versions of Chronoscope.
